reviews.text:
Foxfield Light Railway is such a great place to visit for everyone (dogs included). We paid for my Dad to do the Steam Driver Experience day - worth EVERY penny!!! He had such a great day working on the engine and train working his way around of the jobs. We were able to join him on the train too.
We have previously visited on a public day and had a great time too.
Hot food and bar available on site. Ample parking.

Had a great day. Staff very friendly. Train very good able to ride in any of the three coaches. Food and drink also very good although had to wait due to all coming in when the train came in. Overall a great day.

Friendly crowd. Buffet Room was open and the bar. £3 A pint.
Indoor museum was the loco shed full of stream engines. Everywhere there was momentoes of trains and local industry. The passenger platform was bright with flowers and opposite was bushes in autumn colours.

Lovely people working here. Great if you love trains! Or have little people that do. The cafe is cheap, and the food is not bad. The cafe only accepts cash but you can buy your train ticket with card (£8.50 for as many rides as you want that day)
Great place to visit. Excellent experience to ride on the train. Friendly staff as well as plenty to see. Nice cafe and bar areas too.
